title-group.article-title: Stock Prices and the Dissemination of Analysts' Recommendation

abstract.p: This article investigates alternative explanations for the significant stock price reaction to analysts' information reported in "Heard on the Street" ("HS"). The observed market reaction persists after eliminating firms with confounding releases and firms for which analysts' reports are issued immediately prior to publication. The evidence indicates that "HS" is not usually a secondary dissemination. First, stock prices adjust prior to publication when recommendations are reported on a single firm. Second, analysts have incentives to release information to "HS" before disseminating it to their clients. Overall, the evidence suggests that "HS" gathers information, forms a consensus, and provides it to investors.
